page.title: 04BISHOP'S TACHBROOK p.2
page.content:
{ST.CHAD'S CHURCH.}
St.Chad to whom the church is dedicated was a great figure in the early English Church. He died in 672 and his feast day is kept on 2nd March.There is a stained glass window at nearby{Ladbroke}depicting Chad. The church stands to the north of the village in a high position,which suggests that before Christianity came to Britain it may have been a pagan place of worship. The church dates back to the 12th century and is made of local{Edge Hill and{Hornton}stone.The Saxon or Norman font is still used.The first recorded vicar of the church,in 1327, is Hugo Leyng.A memorial slab to{Walter Savage {Landor}is in the south aisle and the east chancel window is dedicated to Frances Eliza,wife of Charles Kingsley
